;;上周，意大利北部伦巴第的一个农场进行了生猪扑杀。
;

;大量生猪扑杀上周在意大利发生了一场疫情，旨在遏制该国自 20 世纪 60 年代以来最大规模的非洲猪瘟 (ASF) 病毒爆发，该病毒威胁到整个养猪业。

;

;非洲猪瘟对猪来说是致命的，并构成威胁。据世界卫生组织称，这是对全球养猪业的严重威胁，但;对人类没有危险;世界动物卫生组织 (WOAH)。

;

;该组织表示，这种病毒：“在环境中具有很强的抵抗力……[并且]可以在衣服、靴子、车轮和其他材料上生存。”它还可以在各种猪肉产品中生存，例如火腿、香肠或培根”，这意味着“如果不采取适当的措施，人类行为可能在这种猪病跨境传播中发挥重要作用”。

;

;截至今年 5 月，已发现该病毒有 24 种不同的变种或基因型。 WOAH 表示，感染该病毒的生猪死亡率可能高达 100%。

;

;上周，意大利伦巴第大区（被称为意大利的“意大利”）爆发聚集性疫情后，扑杀了近 34,000 头生猪。 ="https://english.fleischwirtschaft.de/economy/news/african-swine-fever-concerns-over-spread-in-italys-main-pork-product-region-56131">;猪肉带;和;欧洲主要生猪产区;之一。

;

;“[在意大利国家猪瘟参考实验室负责人弗朗西斯科·费利齐亚尼 (Francesco Feliziani) 表示：“伦巴第大区是意大利最大的由基因型 II 型 ASF 病毒引起的疫情。”

;

;伦巴第大区的疫情“很快被扑灭”，但“造成了重大影响”。费利齐亚尼说，由于该地区是我国最大的生猪生产地，整个行业都受到威胁。

;

;由于没有针对非洲猪瘟的疫苗，费利齐亚尼表示，为了遏制这种疾病，必须进行扑杀。他说，根本问题“仍然是野猪种群中存在病毒”，这为病毒提供了储存库。

;

;“在欧洲，[ASF] 的威胁非常强大；费利齐亚尼补充说，非洲猪瘟正在扰乱世界各地的养猪业，但他警告说，非集约化、传统的养猪业畜牧业模式可能没有足够的生物安全水平，尤其面临风险，并可能完全消失。

;

;“这将对许多社会阶层产生强烈的经济影响，也会影响农村地区的生物多样性集约化畜牧业是不可能的，并且由于按照传统方法饲养的产品的典型性而得以生存，”他说。

;

;为了控制非洲猪瘟在中国的爆发，生产者;建设多层养猪场< /a>; 与后院畜群相比，这些动物被认为具有更高的疾病控制标准。

;

;由非政府组织 We Animals Media 拍摄的伦巴第扑杀视频片段展示了“整个过程的概述，一位发言人在电子邮件中表示，其中包括一个被改造为移动屠宰场的受感染农场，不间断地运营了一周多。

;

;“工人们从其他受感染农场接收了生猪，并将它们赶进临时屠宰场。他们说：“在集装箱内设置毒气室，然后杀死动物。”

;

;虽然非洲猪瘟对亚洲的野猪多样性构成“重大风险”，但意大利的情况并非如此，那里有大量野猪发言人补充道，意大利的扑杀行动虽然规模较大，但并不是欧洲迄今为止规模最大的，《a href="https://www" 的编辑文森特·特·贝克 (Vincent ter Beek) 表示.pigprogress.net/">;Pig Progress;，一直在跟踪世界各地非洲猪瘟的疫情。

;

;“几年前，罗马尼亚也出现过非洲猪瘟，”他说。 “相比之下……[意大利的扑杀]数量相对较小。我们不要谈论俄罗斯或中国的数字。我并不是想淡化任何事情，这个数量对生产者和猪来说都是可怕的，但这不是欧盟最大的。”

;

;他补充说，人类和野猪仍然是传播的最大风险这种病。 “人类可以让病毒出现在 500 公里外的野猪种群中，;就像几周前在瑞典发生的那样;，然后野猪在它们之间传播，”他说。

;

;鉴于野猪没有被追踪和追踪Ter Beek 表示，这种疾病可以向任何方向传播，但他补充说，公猪传播这种疾病“通常不会很快发生，而是一点一点传播”。

;

;Ter Beek 说 < a href="https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2021/jan/07/could-a-deadly-pig-virus-transform-germanys-fixation-on-cheap-meat">;德国似乎正在做很好地控制了非洲猪瘟;，其努力可以为处理野猪身上的病毒提供蓝图，“尽管各地的地形和野猪种群密度不同”。

;

;病毒传播的结果特贝克说，野猪中可能会出现“暂时数量大大减少的野猪”。然而，丰富的食物和相对温和的冬季意味着“数量将相当快地反弹”，而非洲猪瘟病毒“时不时地卷土重来”，使其很难从一个国家根除。

;

;专家;欧洲兽医联合会;表示：“自2017年以来，欧洲有超过230万头猪因非洲猪瘟而死亡。尽管它对人类无害，但对猪来说可能是致命的，并对受影响国家造成严重的社会经济后果。由于欧洲尚无疫苗，早期发现、预防和报告是遏制这种致命疾病的关键。我们都应该认真对待这件事。”

; Tue, 26 Sep 2023 01:52:01 +0800 Macron launches ‘ecological plan’ to end France’s use of fossil fuels by 2030https://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/sep/25/emmanuel-macron-ecological-plan-end-france-fossil-fuels-by-2030
;;2023-09-25T17:28:16Z;
;
;;伊曼纽尔·马克龙
;

;伊曼纽尔·马克龙公布了一项减少法国温室气体排放的国家“生态计划”排放量减少 55%，并到 2030 年停止使用化石燃料。

;

;法国总统在爱丽舍宫举行特别部长级会议后发表讲话，表示将额外投入 100 亿欧元（87 亿英镑）用于 50马克龙表示，该计划旨在解决气候危机，同时确保法国在农业和工业方面保持竞争力。

; <他说，“法国减少我们对所谓化石燃料、煤炭、汽油和天然气的依赖是至关重要的，我们不再生产这些燃料，但我们依赖它们”。他补充说，我们的目标是到 2030 年将这种依赖程度从 60% 降低到 40%。

;

;“我们设定的优先事项是，到 2027 年 1 月，我们将完全停止对煤炭的使用。电力生产，”他说。

;
;

;;相关：;;透露：欧洲几乎每个人都在呼吸有毒空气;

;
;

;该计划中的其他措施包括加速电动汽车的生产，对燃气锅炉的限制，尽管总统没有全面禁止。它还包括海上风电场的新项目、在法国北部开设几家电池工厂、确定法国自然资源的位置的地图，包括氢气和锂电池的基本元素，以及 7 亿欧元的国家投资区域火车网络。

;

;负责法国 50 个最肮脏工业场所的公司将签署一项协议，在 2030 年前将污染减少 45%。

;

;马克龙表示，国家将下个月收回电价控制权。他表示，将鼓励人们考虑热泵等替代方案，并承诺在未来三年内将泵产量增加三倍，并培训 30,000 名新安装人员。

;

;虽然马克龙宣布了该计划，但法国能源部办公室去年任命了生态规划秘书长后，总理伊丽莎白·博恩起草了这份草案。 Antoine Pellion 的任务是“协调 ;气候、能源、生物多样性和循环经济领域的国家战略;”。

;

;博恩上周向党领导人和生态团体介绍了该计划，其中几项内容形容它令人失望。 “这个生态规划是历史上最长的沟通计划，”来自欧洲生态学 les Verts 的 Marine Tondelier 在会见总理后说道。

;

;社会党领袖奥利维尔·福雷 (Olivier Faure) 表示，该计划“令人失望” ”。

; Tue, 26 Sep 2023 01:52:01 +0800 ‘Exceptional’: Hollywood writers hail tentative deal to end strikehttps://www.theguardian.com/culture/2023/sep/25/hollywood-strike-tentative-deal-update
;;2023-09-25T17:13:06Z;
;
;;7 月在洛杉矶卡尔弗城亚马逊工作室园区外引人注目的作家。
;

; ;好莱坞与工作室高管受到了罢工者和业内其他人士的好评。

;

;美国编剧工会 (WGA) 的成员，他们与电影电视制片人联盟 (AMPTP) 进行了较量< a href="https://apnews.com/article/wga-writers-strike-demands-d403f5b4666f20e2ce3e379bcaef5f2a">;要求;，包括更好的工资和剩余，以及使用人工智能的保障，分享了他们的集体救济.

;
;

;;相关：;;好莱坞编剧罢工：WGA 达成“暂定”协议以结束 146 天罢工;

;
;

;In a ;声明;中表示：“我们已经就新的2023年MBA达成了初步协议，也就是说就所有交易要点原则上达成一致，但须起草最终合同语言。

;

;“我们在这份合同中赢得的东西 - 最特别的是，我们自 5 月 2 日以来获得的一切 - 都归功于这一意愿会员国行使权力，展现团结，并肩前行，承受过去146天的痛苦和不确定性。正是你们的罢工所产生的影响力，再加上我们工会兄弟姐妹的非凡支持，最终使这些公司回到谈判桌上达成协议。”

;

;该组织称这笔交易“非常出色” .

;

;周一，乔·拜登就罢工即将结束发表声明，并赞扬集体谈判的力量。

;

;“我为美国编剧工会和电影联盟喝彩他说：“我们希望与电视制片人达成一项暂定协议，使编剧能够重返讲述我们国家、我们的世界以及我们所有人的故事的重要工作。”

;

;“这项协议，包括与人工智能相关的保证，都来之不易。但它的形成证明了集体谈判的力量。

;

;“雇主和雇员齐心协力，真诚地进行谈判，以达成一项使企业更强大并确保工资的协议，这是无可替代的，工人应得的福利和尊严。我敦促所有雇主记住，所有工人——包括作家、演员和汽车工人——都应该公平分享他们的劳动创造的价值。”

;

;同样在周一，加州州长加文·纽瑟姆给作家们打电话加州经济的重要组成部分。

;

;他在一份声明中表示：“如果没有我们世界级的作家，加州的娱乐业就不会是今天的样子。在 100 多天的时间里，11,000 名作家因职业和生计面临生存威胁而举行罢工，表达了对工人们所感受到的压力和焦虑的真正担忧。

;

;“我很感激双方走到一起，共同解决这一问题。达成一项有利于所有相关方的协议，并且可以让加州经济的一个主要部分重新恢复正常运转。”

;

;为了表示团结，卡车司机工会成员祝贺 WGA 获胜。

;

;为了表示团结，卡车司机工会表示祝贺。 >;

;“车队成员祝贺 WGA East 和 WGA West 作家的战斗精神和坚定不移的团结，在近五个月的罢工后赢得了临时协议！ WGA 罢工激励了世界各地的工人站起来反对企业的贪婪和反工人的技术。 #1u”，该群组;在 X;（以前称为 Twitter）上写道。

;

;演员马克·鲁法洛 (Mark Ruffalo) 也表示在 X 上写道：“太棒了！ WGA 证明，只要我们战斗，我们就会获胜。 #联合。恭喜你。”

; ;

;演员、《办公室》和《明迪项目》等多个项目的编剧和制片人明迪·卡林 (Mindy Kaling) 也加入了纠察线。在宣布暂定协议后，她在 Instagram 上发帖称：“暂定协议 B******！迫不及待地想回去工作，看看我的员工！！！”

;

;在提到她的旧节目时，她引用了迈克尔·斯科特的话说：“我爱我的员工，尽管我用拳头打了你们中的一个人。我的车。”

;

;脱口秀节目在罢工期间暂停，包括《吉米·坎摩尔现场秀》、《斯蒂芬·科尔伯特深夜秀》、《吉米·法伦今夜秀》、《赛斯·迈耶斯深夜秀》和《约翰上周今夜秀》奥利弗。

;

;这些节目的主持人共同合作制作了一个名为《第五打击》的限量系列播客，所有收益都将惠及他们失业的员工。现在已经达成协议，预计演出最早将于 10 月恢复。

;

;在罢工期间恢复德鲁·巴里摩尔秀的计划引起了 WGA 及其支持者的愤怒，但现在罢工已经结束，该剧也可能很快恢复制作。

;

;该剧的代表没有立即回应《卫报》的置评请求。

;

;来自 Sag-Aftra 的罢工同胞代表表演者和广播公司的最大工会祝贺其同事获胜，但表示希望尽快与 AMPTP 达成协议。

;

;在 ;关于 X 的声明;，Sag-Aftra 表示：“对于在 WGA 谈判委员会任职的工会兄弟姐妹，我们衷心祝贺与 AMPTP 达成临时协议。我们赞扬您在过去五个月里的奉献、勤奋和坚定不移的团结，并很自豪能够作为娱乐行业的创意合作伙伴与您并肩作战。

;

;“我们期待审查 WGA 的条款以及 AMPTP 的暂定协议。我们随时准备在 AMPTP 准备好以有意义的方式参与我们的提案后立即恢复我们自己的谈判。

;

;“在那之前，我们将继续保持坚强和团结。为了声援，Sag-Aftra 电视/戏剧/流媒体谈判委员会 #SagAftraStrong。”

; Tue, 26 Sep 2023 01:22:01 +0800 Russian Black Sea fleet commander killed in Crimea, Ukraine claimshttps://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/sep/25/russian-black-sea-fleet-commander-killed-in-crimea-ukraine-claims
;;2023-09-25T16:59:53Z;
;
;;维克托·索科洛夫在塞瓦斯托波尔举行的仪式上敬礼。
;

;乌克兰声称杀死了维克托·索科洛夫上将俄罗斯黑海舰队指挥官与其他 33 名军官一起，发动了基辅对被占领的克里米亚半岛迄今为止最大胆的袭击之一。

;

;乌克兰军方表示 ;周五对俄罗斯布莱克总部的袭击;塞瓦斯托波尔的海上舰队恰逢海军官员会议。

;

;“俄罗斯黑海舰队总部遭到袭击后，包括俄罗斯黑海舰队司令在内的 34 名军官死亡。另有 105 名占领者受伤。特种部队在 Telegram 消息应用程序上表示：“总部大楼无法修复。”

;

;俄罗斯国防部尚未对乌克兰的说法发表评论。莫斯科此前证实了乌克兰的袭击事件，但表示一名军人在袭击中失踪。

;

;《卫报》无法独立证实乌克兰有关索科洛夫的说法或伤亡人数，目前尚不清楚乌克兰军方如何处理统计了袭击中的死伤人数。

;

;索科洛夫的几位近亲拒绝回应置评请求。

;

;周末，乌克兰情报部门负责人凯里洛·布达诺夫 (Kyrylo Budanov) ;告诉美国之音;至少有九人在周五的罢工中，有 16 人丧生，另有 16 人受伤。布达诺夫没有提及索科洛夫，但声称指挥东南前线主要部队的俄罗斯将军亚历山大·罗曼丘克在袭击后“情况非常严重”。

;

;双方都夸大了敌人的损失自从俄罗斯19个月前全面入侵乌克兰以来，俄罗斯却经常对自己的伤亡保持沉默。但考虑到索科洛夫的资历，莫斯科不太可能长期隐瞒他的死亡。

;

;索科洛夫于 2022 年 8 月被任命为驻克里米亚黑海舰队的新指挥官，据报道，去年夏天克里米亚首次遭受乌克兰一系列爆炸袭击后，加强了克里米亚的防御。

;

;他此前曾在太平洋舰队和北方舰队担任过一系列职务，并担任后者的副司令。< /p>;

;一些支持战争的俄罗斯博主周一敦促国防部对乌克兰的说法发表评论“我们希望更快地收到信息……我们都在等待有关俄罗斯黑海舰队指挥官的简单而明确的答案” ”，受欢迎的博主、克里姆林宫前顾问谢尔盖·马尔科夫写道。

;

;最近几周，乌克兰大幅加快了对克里米亚的打击步伐，试图对俄罗斯军队实施战略和象征性打击， 2014 年非法吞并该半岛。
;
; 周末，乌克兰媒体发布了周五袭击的镜头，其中显示英国提供的风暴之影导弹击中了塞瓦斯托波尔海军总部的屋顶。

; Tue, 26 Sep 2023 01:22:01 +0800 ‘Hard to know’ if Bruce Willis is aware of dementia condition, wife sayshttps://www.theguardian.com/film/2023/sep/25/bruce-willis-actor-wife-dementia
;;2023-09-25T16:03:09Z;
;
;;2019 年的布鲁斯·威利斯。威利斯和他的妻子自 2009 年结婚，育有两个女儿。
;

;;布鲁斯·威利斯;被诊断患有额颞叶痴呆六个月后，他的妻子在一次新的采访中透露，“很难知道”这位以《虎胆龙威》和《低俗小说》中的角色而闻名的演员是否意识到自己的病情恶化到了何种程度。

;

;艾玛·海明·威利斯还;告诉;今日霍达·科特布在周一播出的采访中说自确诊以来，她一直是丈夫的“护理伙伴”。

;

;;2023-09-25T16:00:30Z;
;
;;A small bird with yellow belly and brown back sits among foliage
;

;A record-breaking number of “uber-rare” North American songbirds have arrived in the UK this week, blown over the Atlantic in the aftermath of Hurricane Lee.

;

;More than a dozen species of small songbirds – one of which has never been seen in the UK before – were sent veering off their usual migration routes by the high winds.

;

;It was “the largest such arrival ever recorded in the British Isles”, said Dr Alexander Lees, a reader at Manchester Metropolitan University and the chair of the British Ornithologists' Union Records Committee. “One species hasn't been seen before, and several have only been recorded once or twice.”

;

;Their presence has delighted British birdwatchers, who gathered in their hundreds to spot the avian arrivals. “It is like having your football team winning the Premier League,” said Sophie Barrell, an ecologist with a particular interest in birding, who managed to see all three of the rarest species. She said: “Such a long journey is just an incredible feat because they have come miles and miles. To have multiple birds come over, and survive in this way, has just never happened for in my lifetime.”

; ;

;The British birding website ;Rare Bird Alert; described the “spew of uber-rare land birds” as “one of the most memorable couple of days in British and Irish birding history”.

;

;So far, 15 species have been spotted, with 49 individual birds. Included is the Canada warbler, which has never been seen before in the UK. Meanwhile, the bay-breasted warbler had only its second-ever UK sighting, and the magnolia warbler its third. All were spotted in Pembrokeshire, which got the lion's share of activity.

;

;The Chester-based birder Toby Phelps, who was the first to spot the Canada warbler and magnolia warber, ;posted on X;: “I am still in total shock from last week, these are by far the most incredible experiences I have ever had birding.”

;

;The birds' arrival was “a bittersweet phenomenon”, Lees said. “Incredibly exciting for birders … but sad knowing that these are the fortunate few as most of the migrants displaced by the storms will have drowned at sea.”

;
;

;;Related: ;;The crowd goes wild: FC Barcelona reveals Camp Nou stadium's animal inhabitants;

;
; ;

;Strong, early, autumn storms make birds more likely to come over, ;research has suggested;. “Climate models indicate that the frequency of severe storms in the Atlantic will increase as temperatures rise and this may have significant negative impacts on North American bird populations,” Lees said.

;

;It is unlikely these songbirds will be able to fly back across the Atlantic. If they find sufficient food in the UK, it is possible they will continue their migration south, and try to find somewhere warmer to overwinter. Most of them, however, are unlikely to survive.

;

;The last time such a glut of American songbirds were blown over was more than 30 years ago, when bird populations were far larger – but this past week has seen a greater number of birds arrive.

;;2023-09-25T15:00:29Z;
;
;;Cracked earth under a sunset
;

;The formation of a supercontinent on Earth could wipe out humans and any other mammals that are still around in 250m years, according to a study.

;

;The mass extinction would be caused primarily by heat stress as a result of greater volcanic activity that would put twice as much carbon dioxide into the atmosphere as current levels, an older sun that would emit more radiation and the extent of inland deserts in the tropics.

;

;The supercontinent Pangea Ultima is expected to take shape when all the current continents merge together in the distant future. The ;paper, which was published on Monday in Nature Geoscience;, is the first attempt to model how extreme the climate might become from that geological rearrangement.

;

;Using a UK Met Office climate model and the University of Bristol supercomputer, the simulation also provided tectonic clues to past extinction events and data that could be of use to astronomers looking for other habitable planets.

;

;In the era of Pangea Ultima, the temperature extremes are expected to be dramatic, with more humidity than now along the coasts and extremely arid conditions in the vast inland deserts. In this world, global temperatures could rise 15C (and up to 30C on land) above pre-industrial levels, which would return the world to the extreme heat it last went through in the Permian–Triassic era, 260m years ago, when more than 90% of species were eradicated. Protracted periods of heat in excess of 40C would be beyond the tolerance levels of many life forms.

;

;Mammals have been the world's great evolutionary success story, particularly since the demise of the dinosaurs during the last great extinction event, but mammals' ability to adapt to heat may be too slow. That includes humans, which have been on Earth for a relatively short period.

;

;Hominids emerged about 6m years ago when the world was a much cooler place than it had been during the dinosaur period. Although our species has developed remarkably quickly, we would face enormous challenges in the era of Pangea Ultima, assuming we make it through the current self-caused climate crisis and mass extinction of other species.

;

;In addition to the direct impacts of heat, there would be severe food supply problems due to a collapse of vegetation. The paper notes that most plants become stressed at temperatures over 40C and break down completely if exposed to 60C for protracted periods.

;

;The paper's lead author, Alexander Farnsworth, from the University of Bristol, said the prospect of another extinction event, which includes humans, was a sobering reminder of transience. “The Earth has a very changeable environment. Humans are very lucky with what we have now and we should not be pushing our own climate beyond the cooler climate that we evolved through. We are the dominant species but Earth and its climate decide how long that lasts,” he said. “What comes after is anyone's guess. The dominant species could be something completely new.”

;

;The authors acknowledge their prediction has a high level of uncertainty due to the ultra-long-term timeframe, but they hope the study, which was initiated during the pandemic lockdown, will provide useful insights into past mass extinction events and the possible habitability of other planets.

;

;Until now, when astronomers scan distant galaxies for planets that might provide an alternative home for humans, they have mainly considered the distance from the nearest sun and the presence of water. The new study indicates that tectonics are also an important factor in determining the climate of a planet.

;

;“If Nasa could only send a space shuttle to a single planet, then I would choose one that didn't have a super continent,” Farnsworth said. “Better have to have multiple continents scattered around, as is the case now on Earth.”

; Mon, 25 Sep 2023 23:22:01 +0800 Use of antiviral may be fuelling evolution of Covid, scientists sayhttps://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/sep/25/use-of-antiviral-molnupiravir-evolution-covid-virus-mutations
;;2023-09-25T15:00:31Z;
;
;;Capsules of the antiviral pill molnupiravir, which is use to treat Covid patients
;

;An antiviral drug used to treat patients with Covid-19 may be causing mutations in the virus and fuelling the evolution of new variants, scientists have said.

;

;Molnupiravir, which is also sold under the brand name Lagevrio, is designed to mutate coronavirus to destruction, but researchers found evidence that the virus can sometimes survive the treatment, leading to mutated versions that occasionally spread to other people.

;

;There is no evidence molnupiravir has produced more dangerous variants of Covid, but scientists said the mutations increased the genetic diversity of the virus in the wild and provided more options for future evolution.

;

;“People have some concerns about molnupiravir and to some sense this makes those more concrete,” said Dr Theo Sanderson, the lead author on the study and a postdoctoral researcher at the Francis Crick Institute in London. “We know these viruses can still be alive following a significant number of mutations and they can still be transmissible in some cases.”

;

;The findings are important for continuing assessments of the risks and benefits of molnupiravir and other drugs in development that work in a similar way, the researchers say.

;

;Writing in the journal ;Nature;, the scientists describe numerous strands of evidence that suggest molnupiravir can occasionally produce highly mutated but viable forms of the Covid virus. The first sign emerged when the researchers scoured global databases that containing more than 15m Covid genomes. The scientists found hallmark mutations in viruses from 2022, after molnupiravir was introduced. When the drug mutates the virus's ;RNA;, it increases the proportion of specific mutations at certain regions of the genetic code.

;

;As well as spotting signature mutations in Covid viruses obtained from patients, the scientists found that these were more common in countries that used the most molnupiravir, such as the UK, Australia, the US and Japan. Further analyses found the hallmark mutations were more common in Covid virus taken from older patients who awere more likely to be treated with the drug.

;

;As a final piece of evidence, the scientists picked out a number of viral samples in England that bore the signature mutations of molnupiravir and asked the UK Health Security Agency which patients had been treated with the drug. Sanderson said: “That number was much higher than you'd expect by chance, which again suggests it's due to molnupiravir.”

;

;But the implications of the mutations were still unclear, he added. “The signature is very clear, but there aren't any widely circulating variants that have the signature. At the moment there's nothing that's transmitted very widely that's due to molnupiravir.” Most mutations in the virus would be expected to weaken it rather than make it more dangerous.

;

;One question scientists are keen to explore is whether drug-induced mutations explain an unusual finding in ;Oxford University's Panoramic trial;, which is investigating the effectiveness of Covid antivirals. While molnupiravir reduced levels of virus in the first week, levels appeared to rise again at two weeks. This could happen if the drug drives virus down but creates mutated versions that are better at evading patients' immune defences.

;

;The Panoramic trial found molnupiravir did not reduce the risk of hospitalisation or death among vaccinated, high-risk patients faced with the Omicron variant, but it did speed up recovery time.

;

;Prof Chris Butler, a co-investigator on the trial, said it “may be very useful in speeding recovery among key workers, for example, during times of high pressure on services. Molnupiravir may be very useful in certain contexts, but should definitely not be used as a 'treat all' approach.”

;

;Stephen Griffin, professor of cancer virology at the University of Leeds, and was not part of the study or the trial, said: “Does this mean we should stop using molnupiravir? Taking this new evidence together with evidence from the Panoramic trial, there is the suggestion that we should think about whether molnupiravir should be used on its own – but it shouldn't be discarded and could still be valuable if we were to use it in drug combinations.”

;

;MSD, the manufacturer of molnupiravir, said the drug impaired viral replication and reduced shedding, which in turn reduced the risk of transmission.

;

;The company added: “The authors assume these mutations were associated with viral spread from molnupiravir-treated patients without documented evidence of that transmission,. Instead, the authors rely on circumstantial associations between the region from which the sequence was identified and timeframe of sequence collection in countries where molnupiravir is available to draw their conclusions.”
